Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.disk_utils

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import re
import time
import math

from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import TestError
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.filesystem_utils import FilesystemUtils



[docs]class DiskUtils:

[docs]    def __init__(self, host):
        self.host = host



[docs]    def get_block_devices(self, exclude_boot_drive=True):
        """
        Return a list of block devices on the system

        @return String[]: e.g. [sda, sdb, sdc ...]
        """
        output = self.host.run("lsblk -o name,type")
        patt = r"^(nvme\d+n\d+|sd[a-z]*)\s+disk"
        drives = re.findall(patt, output, re.M)

        if not drives:
            raise TestError("Not able to match block devices from lsblk output")

        if exclude_boot_drive:
            boot_drive = self.get_boot_drive()
            if boot_drive:
                drives.remove(boot_drive)

        return drives



[docs]    def get_boot_drive(self):
        """
        @return String: drive name of boot drive
        """
        dev_match = None
        cmd = "lsblk -J"
        lsblk = self.host.run(cmd)
        lsblk = AutovalUtils.loads_json(lsblk, "%s: json conversion" % cmd)
        # Assuming the /boot mountpoint is for boot drive.
        for device in lsblk["blockdevices"]:
            if device["type"] == "disk" and "children" in device:
                for children in device["children"]:
                    if "mountpoint" in children and children["mountpoint"] == "/boot":
                        dev_match = device["name"]
                        return dev_match
        # For Non-Mounted Boot drive, This is needed for hi5
        for device in lsblk["blockdevices"]:
            if device["type"] == "disk":
                out = self.host.run(
                    "file -s /dev/%s" % device["name"]
                )
                if "boot sector" in out:
                    dev_match = device["name"]
                    AutovalUtils.log_info(
                        ("[%s] : Ignoring non-mounted boot drive. " % dev_match)
                        + "To add this drive to test. Clean the drive."
                    )
                    return dev_match
        return dev_match



[docs]    def umount(self, mnt_point):
        """
        Unmount given mount point

        @param String mnt_point: Mount point to unmount
        @return: None. Throws exception on error.
        """
        if FilesystemUtils.is_mounted(self.host, mnt_point):
            self.host.run("umount -fl %s" % (mnt_point))
            self.host.run("rmdir %s" % (mnt_point))



[docs]    def get_all_partitions(self, exclude_boot_drive=True):
        """
        Get a list of drive partitions on system

        @param boolean exclude_boot_drive: set to False to return boot
            drive partitions as well
        @return String[]: list of partitions
        """
        cmd = "lsblk -o name,type"
        output = self.host.run(cmd)
        patt = r"(\w+)\s+part"

        partitions = re.findall(patt, output)

        if exclude_boot_drive:
            partitions = self._remove_boot_drive_partitions(partitions)

        return partitions



[docs]    def _remove_boot_drive_partitions(self, partitions):
        """
        Return a partition list without boot drives from a list of partitions

        @param string[] partitions
        @return string[]
        """
        boot_drive = self.get_boot_drive()
        # e.g. nvme0n1p1, sda1
        pattern = r"%s[p]?\d+" % boot_drive
        result = []

        for part in partitions:
            if not re.match(pattern, part):
                result.append(part)

        return result



[docs]    def get_drive_partitions(self, block_name):
        """
        Get a list of partitions for a drive

        @param String block_name: block name of drive
        return String[]: list of partitions
        """
        # Refresh partitions
        self.host.run("partprobe")
        # Partitions might take more time to come up.
        time.sleep(5)

        cmd = "lsblk -i /dev/%s" % block_name
        out = self.host.run(cmd)

        # Example:
        #  NAME   MAJ:MIN RM   SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT
        #  sda      8:0    0 238.5G  0 disk
        #  |-sda1   8:1    0   243M  0 part /boot/efi
        #  |-sda2   8:2    0   488M  0 part /boot
        #  |-sda3   8:3    0   1.9G  0 part [SWAP]
        #  `-sda4   8:4    0 235.9G  0 part /

        pattern = r"(%s\d+).*part" % (block_name)

        partitions = re.findall(pattern, out)

        return partitions



[docs]    def umount_partition(self, part):
        """
        @param String part: partition to unmount
        """
        umount_command = "umount /dev/%s" % part
        try:
            self.host.run(umount_command)
        except Exception as e:
            if 'not mounted' in str(e):
                pass
            else:
                raise TestError("Fail to umount partition %s: %s" % (part, e))



[docs]    def remove_partition(self, part):
        """
        @param String part: partition to remove
        """
        block_name, part_num = self.split_block_and_part_num_from_partition(part)
        cmd = "parted -a optimal /dev/%s rm %s" % (block_name, part_num)

        try:
            self.host.run(cmd)  # noqa
        except Exception as e:
            if "may not reflect" in str(e):
                AutovalUtils.log_info("Partition %s is removed" % part)
            else:
                raise TestError("Failed to remove partition: %s" + str(e))



[docs]    def split_block_and_part_num_from_partition(self, partition):
        """
        Split sdj2 -> (sdj, 2), or nvme1n1p1 -> (nvme1n1, 1)

        @param String partition name: e.g. sda3
        @return tuple: (drive block name, partition number)
        """
        hdd_part_pattern = r"(\w+)(\d+)"  # e.g. sdj4
        nvme_part_pattern = r"(nvme\dn\d(?=p(\d)))"  # e.g. nvme1n1p1
        m = re.match(nvme_part_pattern, partition)
        if not m:
            m = re.match(hdd_part_pattern, partition)
            if not m:
                raise TestError(
                    "Failed to get partition number from partition: %s" % partition
                )
        return m.groups()



[docs]    def get_hdd_capacity(self, drive, unit="byte"):
        """
        Get an HDD drive capacity

        @param string drive: drive name, e.g. 'sdb'
        @param string unit: GB, TB, MB, etc.
        @return int: drive capacity in given unit
        """
        read_cap_ouput = self.host.run("sg_readcap /dev/%s" % drive)
        pattern = r"Device size: (\d+)"
        m = re.search(pattern, read_cap_ouput)

        if not m:
            raise TestError("Failed to get drive %s capacity" % drive)

        byte_count = int(m.group(1))

        return int(self.convert_from_bytes(byte_count, unit))



[docs]    def convert_from_bytes(self, byte_count, unit):
        """
        Convert capacity from byte unit to other units

        @param int byte_count: drive size in byte
        @param string unit: unit to convert to
        @return float:
        """
        _unit = unit.lower()

        if _unit == "byte":
            size = byte_count
        elif _unit == "gb" or _unit == "g":
            size = (byte_count) / math.pow(10, 9)
        elif _unit == "tb" or _unit == "t":
            size = (byte_count) / math.pow(10, 12)
        elif _unit == "mb" or _unit == "m":
            size = (byte_count) / math.pow(10, 6)

        return size



[docs]    def get_hdd_last_lba(self, drive):
        """
        Get last logical address block for an HDD drive

        @param string drive: drive name e.g. 'sdb'
        @return int
        """
        pattern = r"Last logical block address=(\d+)"
        output = self.host.run("sg_readcap /dev/%s" % drive)

        m = re.search(pattern, output)

        if not m:
            raise TestError("Failed to get last LBA of /dev/%s" % drive)

        return int(m.group(1))



[docs]    def get_md5_sum(self, path):
        """
        @param string path: path of file to get md5
        @return string
        """
        cmd = "md5sum %s" % (path)
        out = self.host.run(cmd)
        m = re.match(r"(\S+)", out)
        if m:
            return m.group(1)
        else:
            raise TestError("Failed to find md5sum in %s" % (out))
